definitions.title: vb. Pō‘.
definitions.body: practice soothsaying (prob. denom., but orig. meaning dub.; connex. with 1. [[עָנׇן]] (De:1s 2, 6) now gen. abandoned; Löw:ZMG xxxi (1877), 539 cp. [[עַיִן]] eye, so We:Skizzen iii. 148 (but v. infr.); RS:JPhil xiv (1885), 119 f. cp. Ar. 9un=ah;un nasal twang, hum of insects, whence diviners as crooning; Ew Gerber:31 of diviner as interpreting hum of insects, whisper of leaves, etc.; We:Heid. 2, 204 now cp. 9ano appear, i. e. dealers in phenomena);—Pf. 3 ms. consec. [[וְעוֹנֵן]] 2Ki 21:6 = 2Ch 33:6; Impf. 2 mpl. [[וְלאׁ תְעוֹנֵ֑נוּ]] Le 19:26 (H); Pt. as subst. [[מְעוֹנֵן]] De 18:10 (forbidden), pl. [[מְעׂנְנִים]] v:De 18:14, ´[[מְעוֹ]] Mic 5:11, [[אֵלוֹן מְעוֹנְנִים]] Ju Jdg 9:37 (v. 1. [[אֵלוֹן]]; seat of an oracle, cf. RS:Sem i. 179 2nd ed. 196); also (without [[מְ]], cf. Sta:§ 233 Kö:i. 349) [[עׂנְנִים]] Is 2:6, sf. [[עׂנְנֵיכֶם]] Je 27:9; fs. in [[בְּנֵי]] [[עׂנְנׇה]] Is 57:3 sons of a soothsaying woman, fig. of apostates.—Vid. [[כִּשֵּׁף]], II. [[[נׇחַשׁ]]], [[[קָסַם]]].
